dct_description_sm: California labeled "C". Initials are used as place names throughout, and are keyed to an atlas index. It was used as a teaching atlas.
California as an island with broad, indented northern coast; southern portion is elongated and narrow.

All 4 maps untitled, but with pagination top right, within border. On sheet: Europe, [page]4, (top left); Asia, [page]5, (top right); Africa, [page]6, (bottom left); and America, [page]7, (bottom right).

Issued in: Atlas methodicus explorandis juvenum profectibus in studio geographico ad Methodum Hübnerianam / accommodatus a Ioh. Bapt. Homanno [Johann Baptist Homann]. -- Norimbergæ, 1719. Printed in Latin and German.

Cartography is very similar to hismuch larger map of [1710] and other German maps pf various sizes: Weigel's maps of 1725, Seutter's [1730] map, and Kilian's 1758 map. Its layout with 3 other maps on one sheet is like that of the Homann Heirs (engraved by Gottfried Hensel) of [1746].
